column4: i'll bet nobody knows how to add downloads to the installer. typical.
how do i add downloads to the installer? know the syntax? :)
anyhow!!!! i have an archive folder with uninstalled debs. i need to have the installer acknowledge it, and add it to the install list. any ideas? :)
you don't add apps to the installer. You add repos to the list of repos the installer uses. The apps are added in the repos and their server is responsible for that stuff.
update list in the installer? it Does_not_Freaking work for archive files.
you have packages on a disk or something? You can use dpkg to install those.
do you know the dpkg syntax? i tried it before and it failed to see the individual programs because there was no list. i tried to generate a list, and that failed.
so. i first enter the folder. go, sudo dpkg -i file -- and that's all i need to do?
If you have a dir full of .debs and you know you want to install them all, you can do:  sudo dpkg -i /path/dir/*.deb
thank you very much!!! let me give it a shot!!! thanks!!! :)
I don't think that would work because normal directories aren't setup with the files needed to make it a repo
this is soooooo stoooopid. i mean, the whole deal. i'm tiring fast. my god, doesn't debian have a useful syntax? is it applicable for ubuntu?
